Heya's,
While casually looking over the code for my scenario converter I managed to
find a bug related to reading and writing names.

Basically the program stores only names of 10 characters (well 11, but it
messes things up then) instead of the 12 set by the specifications.  In
general this doesn't have much of an effect, although it is writing out a
12th garbage character from who knows where (potential for it to crash).

I've decided that with uni holidays approaching I'll put off releasing an
update (I fixed the bug already, so if you are concerned I'll upload it
again) until after I've gone through the scenario class and cleaned it up a
fair bit - something that will help a lot with the final editor (provided
its written it in C++) and as a side effect also with porting, even though
that isn't needed :)

Just thought I'd let you all know about it, this might also explain some of
the quirky behaviour (it does read and write the correct number of bytes,
just doesn't store them all) that DPH was reporting.

Will keep ya's posted once I get to working on it again (sometime in the
middle of November).

Cya's,
Deathifier
